Seated downstairs. Nobody seated there yet, just us. The waitress (if you can call her that) busied herself setting tables. She looked at us, then kept setting tables. And setting, and setting, while we looked at her with that "ready" look.  I mean, we couldn't believe this, since we were her only customers.  Finally she came over to us...we ordered their "chicken" tapas, only to be served little round fried balls of God knows what-a slimy wet interior that was ice cold in the middle. The onion soup was ok, nothing special.  But we'll never forget the rude server (youngish, 20 something, long dark hair). This was on April 1, 2016, about 2 pm.
